Title: Senior Revenue Enablement Specialist (Partnerships)
RoleDescription:
About Us

The Sales Enablement Team is dedicated to equipping our 450+ sales professionals and partners with the skills, knowledge, tools & processes through  training, and insights to drive ongoing success. This includes onboarding, continuous development, and cross-functional collaboration.
Role Overview
As a Senior Revenue Enablement Specialist (Partnerships), you will play a key role in consultation, development and delivery training programs for our partner teams. You will onboard new partners, enhance existing partnerships through project management, develop continuous training, and collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to optimise learning programs. Additionally, you will support enablement initiatives for our global sales team.
Key Responsibilities
Partner & Reseller Enablement

Leverage data and insights to identify skill gaps and develop enablement recommendations
Develop and deliver onboarding programs to accelerate partner and reseller productivity.
Create and maintain enablement materials tailored for partner success.
Gather feedback and continuously improve training programs.

Sales Enablement & Development

Manage knowledge checks to ensure sales teams stay informed on product updates.
Keep teams up-to-date on competitive insights and industry trends.
Track and analyze the effectiveness of enablement initiatives.
Identify and address skill gaps through targeted training.

Operational Support & Collaboration

Optimise enablement tools (Gong, LMS, CMS & SF) and resources for efficiency.
Foster alignment between Sales, Partnerships, Product, and Marketing teams.
Ensure enablement initiatives support company goals and partner growth.

Required Skills & Experience

3+ years of experience in sales, marketing, or enablement in a B2B SaaS or high-tech environment.
Proven track record in partner management.
Experience in sales training and development, ideally within tech or SaaS.
Strong knowledge of sales processes, methodologies, and enablement strategies.
Excellent communication, presentation, and project management skills.
Data-driven mindset with analytical problem-solving abilities.
Ability to manage multiple projects and adapt to shifting priorities.
Willingness to work in-office up to 5 days per week, depending on training needs.

Nice to Have

Experience with B2B SaaS sales, ERP, or expense management solutions.
Familiarity with Salesforce CRM.
Background in instructional design or training development.

Benefits

 Competitive compensation, including equity in the company;
 Generous vacation days so you can rest and recharge;
 Health perks such as private healthcare or gym allowance, depending on location;
 "Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary;
